Extracted Information:

1. Incident involving the use of the N-word by a guest speaker during a classroom presentation at George Brown College on March 15, 2023.
2. The Office of Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights Services (OAREHRS) conducted a formal investigation into the incident.
3. Following the investigation, recommended remedies include reinforcing policies, implementing guidelines on use of language and visuals, providing comprehensive training, and introducing a process for guest speakers to confirm compliance with policies.
4. The college acknowledges the harm caused by the use of racial slurs and condemns such behavior.
5. Counselling support is available through the Counselling and Student Well-being Team.
6. Students can connect with the Office of Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights (OAREHRS) to discuss the matter or make a complaint with a Human Rights Advisor.
7. The college has established principles of equity, diversity, and inclusion in its Strategic Plan and is taking concrete steps to combat anti-Black racism on campus.

Dr. Gervan Fearon is the President of George Brown College. The college is committed to confronting racism and fostering a safe and respectful learning, teaching and working community animated by principles of equity, diversity, mutual respect, and accountability. An incident occurred that was unacceptable and against these principles, and the college will continue to work towards building a safe and inclusive community for all students and employees. The institution is deeply committed to ensuring employees receive Anti-Racism training and implementing a comprehensive Anti-Racism Action Plan, including signing the Scarborough Charter on Anti-Black Racism and Black Inclusion.
